job description:
Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems (IDS) is seeking motivated and capable systems engineers with a track record of successfully developing Built-In Test and Diagnostics for advanced ground based radar systems. The successful candidate will have experience in requirements design, analysis, documentation, development and integration of Built-In test and diagnostics for systems. This position includes supporting existing and new military programs.

This role may include supporting customer demonstrations and software/systems integration and testing related travel. Qualified candidate must have an existing DOD Secret Clearance.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Collaborate on the development of effective testability, Built-In test (BIT), and diagnostic technical solutions
  • Develop BIT, testability and diagnostic associated requirements
  • Perform testability analyses to verify diagnostic effectiveness and facilitate troubleshooting activities at all levels of factory test and maintenance
  • Confer with hardware/software design teams to define sub-system failure modes, their effects on the system, and associated detection and isolation methodologies
  • Collaborate with hardware/software design teams to develop diagnostic test capabilities
  • Participating in trade study investigations to optimize the design for diagnostics
  • Develop source data for design reviews and customer presentations
  • Generate formal reports to document analytical results
  • Develop BIT Algorithm Description Documents
  • Provide technical support for systems planning, execution, and documentation activities
Required Skills:
  • Minimum 8 years of related experience
  • Experience with testability analysis tools
  • Experience in failure modes and mechanisms related complex system designs
  • Experience working with and interpreting interfaces between hardware and software
  • Experience in working with software/firmware development and implementation
  • Experience performing circuit analysis and evaluating circuit designs
  • Experience with mechanical CAD authoring or design evaluation
  • Experience with product testing and troubleshooting in the factory/depot or field environment
  • Experience with testability/diagnostics aspects of system development engineering
  • Experience applying systems principles, processes, and analysis
  • Experience analyzing data from a variety of sources using standard modeling tools
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications
  • Experience working across multiple organizational levels
  • Ability to obtain DoD Secret Clearance
  • U.S. Citizenship
Desired Skills:
  • Existing DoD Secret clearance
  • Ability to function well in a high pressure multi-tasking environment
  • Radar system experience
  • Possess strong people and change agent skills
  • Diagnostic dependency modeling experience
  • Experience working in the DoD customer community (US Army, US Air Force, US Navy)
Required Education:
  • BS degree in electrical or systems engineering, physics or related technical field.
Desired Education:
  • MS degree in electrical or systems engineering, physics or related technical field.
